title: Kadri Temple
sneakPeek: Ancient historical site.
details:
-The Kadri Manjunatha Temple is the oldest shiva temple in Mangaluru, dating back to the 10th or 11th century.
-It is known for its beautiful bronze statues and natural spring water tanks called 'Gomukhas'.
-Also known for the unique ancient laterite structures known as the 'Pandava Caves'.

title: Kudroli Gokarnanath
sneakPeek: A magnificent temple built by Narayana Guru.
details:
-Built in 1912 by the social reformer Narayana Guru for the Billava community.
-Dedicated to Gokarnanatha, a form of Lord Shiva.
-Famous for its grand 'Mangalore Dasara' celebrations where life-size idols of Navadurgas are displayed.
-The temple features a unique architecture with golden gopurams and water tanks.

title: Mangaladevi Temple
sneakPeek: The historic temple that gave Mangalore its name.
details:
-A 9th-century temple built by King Kundavarman of the Alupa dynasty.
-The city of Mangalore is named after the presiding deity, Goddess Mangaladevi.
-Built in the Kerala style of architecture with wooden pillars and sloping roofs.
-It holds special significance for unmarried women who perform rituals here for a suitable match.

title: Sharavu Mahaganapathi
sneakPeek: An ancient Ganesha temple in the heart of the city.
details:
-Located in Hampankatta, this temple is over 800 years old.
-The name 'Sharavu' is derived from 'Shara' (arrow), linked to a legend involving Maharaja Veerabahu.
-It is a major center for Yakshagana (traditional dance drama) and cultural activities.
-Celebrates Ganesh Chaturthi and the Festival of Lights (Deepothsava) with great grandeur.

title: Kateel Durgaparameshwari
sneakPeek: A sacred temple situated on an islet in the Nandini River.
details:
-Located about 26km from Mangalore, this temple is set amidst the scenic River Nandini.
-Dedicated to Goddess Durga Parameshwari.
-Famous for its Yakshagana troupe (Kateel Mela), which performs plays as an offering to the goddess.
-The temple provides free meals (Annadhanam) to thousands of devotees daily.

title: St. Aloysius Chapel
sneakPeek: Famous for its Sistine Chapel-style frescoes.
details:
-Built in 1880 by Jesuit Missionaries on Lighthouse Hill.
-Renowned for the magnificent paintings by Italian artist Antonio Moscheni that cover the walls and ceilings.
-The frescoes depict the life of St. Aloysius Gonzaga and Jesus Christ.
-It is often compared to the Sistine Chapel in Rome due to its artistic grandeur.

title: Rosario Cathedral
sneakPeek: The oldest church in Karnataka with a magnificent dome.
details:
-Originally built by the Portuguese in 1568, making it the oldest church in the region.
-The current structure (1910) features a massive dome modeled after St. Peter's Basilica in the Vatican.
-It is the only church in the Mangalore Diocese with a dome over the sanctuary.
-Historically, the cross on the dome was lit at night to serve as a beacon for seafarers.

title: Milagres Church
sneakPeek: A historic Roman Catholic church in Hampankatta.
details:
-Built in 1680 by Bishop Thomas de Castro, it is one of the oldest churches in Dakshina Kannada.
-Known for its beautiful white marble altar and Neo-Gothic architecture.
-The original structure was destroyed by Tipu Sultan and rebuilt in 1784.
-Dedicated to Our Lady of Miracles (Milagres).

title: Infant Jesus Shrine
sneakPeek: A powerful pilgrimage center known for miracles.
details:
-Located in Bikarnakatte, this shrine is dedicated to the Infant Jesus of Prague.
-Famous for its unique architecture featuring five huge columns representing the fingers of God's hand.
-Thursdays are special days here, attracting thousands of devotees for mass and novena.
-A place of deep spiritual solace situated on Carmel Hill.

title: St. Lawrence Church
sneakPeek: A serene parish surrounded by nature in Bondel.
details:
-Located on the way to Bajpe Airport, known as a 'Bon Vale' (Good Valley) by early missionaries.
-Dedicated to St. Lawrence, the patron saint of miracles.
-Known for its peaceful ambiance, recent renovations, and beautiful altar.
-Features a large open ground often used for community events and gatherings.

title: Zeenath Baksh
sneakPeek: A unique wooden mosque dating back to 644 AD.
details:
-Also known as the 'Beliye Palli', this is the 3rd oldest mosque in India.
-Established by Arab traders around 644 AD.
-Renovated by Tipu Sultan, who added the exquisite wooden pillars and carvings.
-It is the only mosque in Karnataka made entirely of wood, showcasing rare Indian architectural styles.

title: Ullal Dargah
sneakPeek: A famous pilgrim center known for the Uroos festival.
details:
-The tomb of the saint Syed Mohammad Sherifulla Madani, who came from Medina 400 years ago.
-Located in Ullal, about 10km from the city center.
-Famous for the 'Uroos' festival celebrated once every 5 years, which attracts thousands of pilgrims.
-Believed to have miraculous healing powers for devotees of all faiths.

title: Idgah Mosque
sneakPeek: Historic mosque with panoramic city views.
details:
-Built by Tipu Sultan in the 18th century on Light House Hill.
-Holds great historical significance as a watchtower location for the Mysore Navy.
-Offers a commanding view of the city and the Arabian Sea.
-A major center for Eid prayers, gathering thousands of worshippers.

title: Jamia Masjid Kudroli
sneakPeek: Magnificent Mughal-style architecture.
details:
-Renovated to resemble the famous Jama Masjid of Delhi.
-Features towering 134-foot minarets and a massive dome.
-A symbol of communal harmony, historically formed by uniting two twin mosques ('Jod Palli').
-Located in the Kudroli area, it is one of the largest mosques in the region.

title: Kudupu Ananthapadmanabha
sneakPeek: Famous for Naga Mandala and serpent worship.
details:
-Located 10km from Mangalore on the Moodbidri route.
-Dedicated to Lord Ananthapadmanabha (Vishnu) and famous for serpent worship (Naga Aradhana).
-The temple has a holy pond called 'Bhadra Saraswathi Thirtha' on the left side.
-Devotees perform 'Ashlesha Bali' here to ward off Sarpa Dosha.

title: Urwa Marigudi
sneakPeek: A powerful 800-year-old Goddess temple.
details:
-The main deity is Goddess Mariyamma, believed to be the sister of Mangaladevi.
-Built by the Mogaveera community around 800 years ago.
-Fishermen offer gold pendants in the shape of fish/crabs/prawns when their prayers for a good catch are answered.
-Famous for the 'Mari Pooje' festival.

title: Polali Rajarajeshwari
sneakPeek: Home to a massive clay idol and the Chendu festival.
details:
-An 8th-century temple located on the banks of the Phalguni river.
-Famous for its 10-foot tall clay idol of the Goddess, which is historically believed to be 5000 years old.
-Known for the unique 'Polali Chendu' (football) festival, a leather ball game played during the annual fair.
-The temple architecture features intricate wooden carvings.

title: Sri Venkataramana Temple
sneakPeek: The heart of the GSB community and the Car Festival.
details:
-Sri Venkataramana Temple (SVT) is one of the most prominent temples in Mangalore.
-Famous for the 'Kodial Teru' (Car Festival) held in Jan/Feb, which attracts thousands.
-The temple follows the Madhwa Vaishnava tradition.
-The main deity is Lord Veera Venkatesha Swamy.

title: Mukhyaprana Temple
sneakPeek: A powerful Hanuman temple located on Car Street.
details:
-Located adjacent to the Sri Venkataramana Temple on Car Street.
-Dedicated to Mukhyaprana (Hanuman) and established around 1804.
-Devotees offer 'Vade Mala' (garland of vadas) and 'Rangapooja' here.
-Known for its peaceful atmosphere and the belief that the deity fulfills all sincere wishes.

title: Bappanadu Durgaparameshwari
sneakPeek: A symbol of communal harmony in Mulki.
details:
-Located in Mulki, on the banks of the Shambhavi River.
-Legend says the temple was built by a Muslim merchant named Bappa Beary, symbolizing communal harmony.
-Famous for the 'Bappanadu Dolu', a massive drum beaten during festivals.
-The main deity is worshipped in the form of a Linga.

title: Kavoor Mahalingeshwara
sneakPeek: Ancient Shiva temple near a scenic lake.
details:
-A historic temple dating back to the 13th-14th century, located in Kavoor.
-Legend says it was founded by sage Maharshi Kavera.
-Known for its grand 'Maha Shivaratri' celebrations and the annual 'Rathotsava' (Car Festival).
-The temple premises include a large, serene lake.

title: Car Street Raghavendra Matha
sneakPeek: A major spiritual hub in the heart of the city.
details:
-Located on Car Street (Ratha Beedhi) near the famous Venkataramana Temple.
-Houses the 'Mrithika Brindavana' of Sri Raghavendra Swami.
-A center for Dwaita philosophy, daily poojas, and 'Anna Santarpana' (free meals).
-Part of the vibrant religious ecosystem of Mangalore's temple square.

title: Kavoor Raghavendra Matha
sneakPeek: A serene and modern spiritual center.
details:
-Located in the quiet suburb of Kavoor, distinct from the Car Street branch.
-Recently renovated into a spacious complex with a modern community hall.
-Offers a peaceful environment for meditation and prayer.
-Known for special poojas on Thursdays and the annual Aradhana Mahotsava.

title: Urwa Store Ganapathi
sneakPeek: A popular community temple for new beginnings.
details:
-Located at the busy Urwa Store junction, serving as a landmark for locals.
-Dedicated to Lord Ganesha (Mahaganapathi), the remover of obstacles.
-Distinct from the Sharavu Ganapathi temple, this is a community-centric place of worship.
-Famous for grand Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations and Sankashti Chaturthi poojas.
